titleStmt.title: The strangling and death of the Great Turke, and his two sonnes VVith the strange preservation and deliverance of his Vncle Mustapha from perishing in prison, with hunger and thirst, the young emperour now three dayes before having so commanded. A wonderfull story, and the like never heard of in our moderne times, and yet all to manifest the glory and providence of God, in the preservation of Christendome in these troublesome times. Printed this fifteenth of Iuly.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by I. D[awson] for Nicholas Bourne and Thomas Archer, and are to be sold at their shops at the Exchange, and in Popes-head Pallace,

notesStmt.note: Identified as STC 18883 on UMI microfilm.
Cropped at head, affecting pagination and some text.
Reproduction of the original in the Folger Shakespeare Library.
